title: Labour says Farage would revive austerity as he prepares to set out economic vision in speech – UK politics live
summary: Reform UK leader is set to announce plans for deregulation and spending cuts. Both Labour and Conservative parties are criticizing these proposed policies. The political landscape is heating up as parties position themselves ahead of upcoming elections.

title: Peter Watkins: an English film-making revolutionary from a tradition of uncompromising radicalism
summary: Director Peter Watkins pioneered the mock-documentary style in films like The War Game, Culloden, and Punishment Park. He utilized this innovative approach to create historical dramas and timely dystopian narratives that feel both immediate and authentic. His work has significantly influenced the portrayal of real-life events and societal issues in cinema.

title: Want to know everything? Perhaps it’s best if you don’t
summary: Life is filled with uncertainties and surprises, from exams to dating and parenting challenges. Embracing this reality can lead to greater happiness. Acceptance of life's unpredictability is key to navigating its ups and downs.

title: It’s clear why Zohran Mamdani has a double-digit lead in the New York mayoral race | Margaret Sullivan
summary: Mamdani's message offers a clear and distinct perspective that differentiates him from many Democratic politicians. His straightforward approach resonates with his audience, highlighting a focus on core issues. This clarity sets him apart in a crowded political landscape.

title: Don’t Trip review – lo-fi comedy shocker sets out to find the horror in Hollywood
summary: A film initially promising as a sharp satire of the film industry devolves into an unconvincing and poorly executed narrative. Despite Fred Melamed's efforts, the movie fails to maintain its initial intrigue and ultimately falls flat. The transition from clever commentary to a chaotic mess undermines its original potential.
